name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): Filmography
long_desc:
Spring 2015 Course Description:
The theme is "The Pragmatics of Romantic Relationships" and will represent the final academic offering in the 98-201 Filmography course sequence. If waitlisted, please contact instructor directly for availability. What makes a romantic relationship work? When do these relationships begin to fall apart? In this course, we will ground our cinematic expectations of romance within the pragmatics of emotional availability, long-distance, and human sexuality. Throughout the semester, students will be introduced to the subtleties of fate, the nuances of infidelity, and the boundaries of attachment within both healthy and dysfunctional on-screen partnerships, as seen across cinema's most pragmatic films on romantic relationships. To successfully complete this course, you must have a demonstrated interest in becoming conversant in film (or relationships) before graduation -- and of course, you'll have to have a little faith in people. A course fee of $10/student will be collected at the beginning of the semester towards weekly refreshments and lecture series.
